Articles.Content:
Have you tried with RCS Sounds uninstalled? To verify that's the issue?

yeah it only happens with rcs sounds running. I have a feeling it may be to do with either engine configs or as it's the RO files it's interfering with, probably multiple modules for the same item conflicting i.e. the rcs ones. I think there was a problem with it mentioned around RF 4. Also RF5 kinda messed up my tanks in career abit, the stretchy ones are mostly limited to 8000 units and the super stretchys won't unlock after purchasing in R&D :/?

pingopete: Did you follow instructions for both RF v5 and Stretchy v9?

Also, I'll investigate: it may be that an update to RCS Sounds broke the compatibility fixes I added to RF.
Im having the same problem as pingopete, definitely only with this installed.

awesome mod! ,I dont have any issues either (so far), and I am not running the real fuels. I do have a ton of mods though and parts that I have done myself...but so far no issues yet. It even works with my custom rcs thrusters. so this is a permanent mod for me and I thank you!

pingopete: Did you follow instructions for both RF v5 and Stretchy v9?

Also, I'll investigate: it may be that an update to RCS Sounds broke the compatibility fixes I added to RF.

Installed latest of RF, Stretchy, and RCS sounds still getting this problem, latest Stretchy fixed my tank issue though, thanks.
Any word on why the new version sounds don't work on interiors even if you disable the exterior option?

Any word on why the new version sounds don't work on interiors even if you disable the exterior option?

I did some checking for that last night. It's a bug. It'll be fixed for the next release. Thanks for the bug report!
RCS Sounds version 4.0 for the KSP 0.23.5 ARM pack is now available here. It fixes the internal sounds issue and uses the new version of Module Manager.
awesome! ty for the update!

Hey i had a quick question: While opening the zip file, there's a "modulemanager 2.0.1.dll" file, but the most current one is 1.5.6 . Where does the 2.0.1 file come from?

Edit: 2.0.1 is the updated one, but it wasn't changed in the main post of the modulemanager thread.

Edited April 9, 2014 by Mokmo
This is pure awesome. Docking should be less boring now.
Appears to be working just fine in .24 (with Module Manager 2.2.0 dll)

I don't like the muddy "farting" sound of the included rcs sounds. So, I whipped up my own version. These would replace the .wav files in \GameData\RcsSounds\Sounds

http://mrblaq.com/kerbal/RCSSounds.zip

I don't like the muddy "farting" sound of the included rcs sounds. So, I whipped up my own version. These would replace the .wav files in \GameData\RcsSounds\Sounds

http://mrblaq.com/kerbal/RCSSounds.zip

Awesome, better than "stock" sounds.

Pizzaoverhead, put these as dafault into mod.
Does this work in v0.24?

Does this work in v0.24?

I am not running into any problems (64 bit install) but it has not been updated officially yet. You could try it out and see what happens.

I am not running into any problems (64 bit install) but it has not been updated officially yet. You could try it out and see what happens.

It should work fine; nothing that it touches has changed.

Hey i had a quick question: While opening the zip file, there's a "modulemanager 2.0.1.dll" file, but the most current one is 1.5.6 . Where does the 2.0.1 file come from?

Edit: 2.0.1 is the updated one, but it wasn't changed in the main post of the modulemanager thread.

The most recent version should be 2.2.0.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-Module-Manager-1-5-6-(Jan-6)

I've tried it. It destroys the ability to throttle up and pretty much destroys any keyboard function.

Sounds of "farts" can be heard going off one after another.

I'm using 32-bit version of KSP because 64-bit loses framerate.
Tried this in 64-bit without issues, however I don't really like the "farting" sounds of the propellant. Just a personal opinion!
After I've removed it, keyboard works again and I can actually go to space today.

After 0.24.2 update I am getting this errors:

KSP.log


[EXC 23:51:16.241] MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
[EXC 23:51:16.243] MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
[EXC 23:51:16.245] MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
[EXC 23:51:16.246] MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.

output_log.txt


MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
  at Part.ModulesOnUpdate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at Part.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

(Filename:  Line: -1)

MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
  at Part.ModulesOnUpdate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at Part.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

(Filename:  Line: -1)

MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.GetConnectedResources'.
  at Part.ModulesOnUpdate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

  at Part.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

(Filename:  Line: -1)

It's not just this couple of lines, it's more like couple thousand of lines.

RCS is working, but there is no sound.

Removing mod fix the issue.
I have no RCS sound with this mod either even in 0.24.1

After 0.24.2 update I am getting this errors:

--snip--

It's not just this couple of lines, it's more like couple thousand of lines.

RCS is working, but there is no sound.

Removing mod fix the issue.

Same for me. I was happy to have all my sounds covered between this and ion engine sound mod. Alas. I hope it's fixed soon!
rcs sounds are broken here too with 0.24.2
